articles.author: Eder Campuzano | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: Southern Oregon county terminates $45,000 jail contract with ICE
articles.description: Josephine County Sheriff Dave Daniel said it was a "risk versus reward" move, citing lawsuits against two other Oregon counties over federal detainees.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: 2nd suspect arrested in Josephine County killing; woman still sought
articles.description: The body of John Reitterer was found June 22 in a shallow creek along the Illinois River near the southwestern Oregon town of Selma.

articles.author: Anna Marum | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: Police arrest last suspect wanted in Josephine County murder
articles.description: John Reitterer was found dead in a shallow creek in the Rogue River-Siskiyou National Forest.

articles.author: Molly Young | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: Southern Oregon fire leads to discovery of body, accusation of murder
articles.description: Troy Dawson, of Murphy, was arrested Saturday morning.

articles.author: Maxine Bernstein | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: Ken Medenbach seeks judge's permission to attend Bundy trial in Nevada
articles.description: Medenbach's probation officer already denied the request. On Tuesday, Medenbach's defense lawyer filed a motion asking U.S. District Judge Michael J. McShane to allow Medenbach to support the Bundys and attend their Nevada trial.

articles.author: Maxine Bernstein | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: Appeals court upholds public lands protester Ken Medenbach's sentence
articles.description: The 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals also upheld the travel and other restrictions placed on Medenbach as conditions of his probation.

articles.author: Maxine Bernstein | The Oregonian/OregonLive
articles.title: Ken Medenbach gets green light to attend 7 days of Bundy trial in Nevada
articles.description: A judge ordered Medenbach not to wear or display any clothing or buttons with messages while in the federal courtroom, noting that he was ordered to remove one that read "jury nullification" and "not guilty'' during the Oregon refuge occupation trial.
